name: Navigation project
description: This standalone project integrates the admin section built in ReactJS with a NestJS backend, developed to connect store products with the Focalpay app, enabling a navigation feature for customers.

My responsibility involved developing the main backend service and the admin frontend. I managed core data operations and provided a data feed for the navigation service, supporting route calculation and delivering real-time navigation information to the end-user web app.

name: Centra: 3th-party application
description: Centra is an advanced e-commerce platform that consumer brands can use. It has features for both direct-to-consumer and wholesale e-commerce.

FocalPay is also an e-commerce platform, and its main goal is to manage physical stores. FocalPay started to integrate with other platforms so users could use FocalPay's services along with their other web-based solutions.
The idea behind the project I developed was to create a service that would make it easy and safe for other e-commerce platforms to connect to FocalPay, and vice versa.

name: Landing site: static webpage
description: I was asked to make a landing page in just 3 days. This was a good chance for me to test my skills and create a basic web page that my customer could use for their future web app projects.

So I made a simple, lightweight web page using Angular 16. I used static JSON files as the data source, instead of using a backend (it was temporary and implemented like JSON server project). This let my customer manage their own web page before their deadline.

You can see it at the link below. I hope this landing page stays up for a long time on their website. After that, I will add this landing page to the project section of my website so anyone can access it.

name: Robot-test framework
description: The use of a robot test framework allows us to thoroughly validate the smooth operation and proper functionality of all our APIs, thereby ensuring the reliability and efficiency of our critical and sensitive services.
Also, this approach allows us to quickly and comprehensively validate any changes or new features before deploying them to production.

My responsibility was to develop the structure of a robot testing project. This involved utilizing and implementing temporary services using a Docker-in-Docker approach. also, I was tasked with writing the test case code in order to enhance the speed of test writing with test team.

name: Focalpay Order API
description: My responsibilities in this project include developing system test framework for the Order APIs. This project uses the most up-to-date frameworks and technologies, that requires me to update my knowledge to leverage state-of-the-art solutions.

name: Cashier front-end platform
description: In this project, my primary focus was on enhancing the performance of the existing Vue.JS front-end application. Also, I took the responsibility of implementing Cypress codes to enable automated testing for both end-to-end (E2E) and component-based test scenarios.

name: Mofid Online Plus
description: The main challenge I encountered was managing an exceptionally high volume of backend requests, approximately 30 million per hour. Consequently, my primary tasks revolved around optimizing our API, utilizing asynchronous functions appropriately, identifying and eliminating zombie threads, enhancing code quality, and redesigning the APIs for the updated versions of the "Online Plus" and "Hamrah Plus" applications.

name: Mofid Online Admin
description: The team faced several key challenges, such as refactoring and redesigning the code, optimizing database stored procedures, and implementing new APIs. Despite the tight timeframe, I successfully delivered a product that met the latest standards and was ready for deployment.

name: Vicinia Map-Library
description: I developed a map-library package to enhance Google Maps with new features, allowing other applications within Cntxts Inc. to seamlessly utilize these capabilities without any extra code.

The significant additions to this project include 2D and 2.5D maps for buildings, improved pins and information display, and the implementation of routing and directions to guide users from their source to their destination.

name: Vicinia Back-end
description: Refactoring and upgrading the versions of Vicinia back-end's dependencies, such as packages and frameworks are some of my responsibility. Also, the project needs ongoing maintenance and the implementation of new APIs to support the development of new features.

name: Vicinia Desk
description: Despite the widespread availability of online maps with routing and positioning tools, integrated routing systems for buildings, commercial centers, universities, and hospitals have yet to be fully developed.

This project seeks to address this need by providing indoor routing capabilities, information services, and an integrated anti-theft system for building equipment. As a developer on this project, my role involved the development of both the front-end and back-end parts of kiosks admin (back-office).

name: Kiosk web app
description: The Kiosk web application is designed to facilitate routing and content display within entertainment complexes, universities, and administrative centers.

As the developer of this project, I was responsible for both the front-end and back-end development, utilizing Angular 15 and ExpressJS. By leveraging these technologies, I was able to create a dynamic and responsive platform that can be easily customized to meet the unique needs of each client.
I take pride in having contributed to the development of a sophisticated solution that enhances the user experience and improves overall productivity within these settings.

name: Farawams Identity Server
description: The aim of this project was to create comprehensive authentication and authorization services that could support a variety of application types, including mobile, web, native, and other services. To achieve this, we utilized OpenID Connect and OAuth2.1 protocols and implemented a single session input and output system.

name: Pinkie (under construct)
description: I am interested in developing an Android application using the Angular framework. The project I have in mind is a semi-social network software that is still in the early stages of development. My goal is to create a user interface that is similar to Instagram, with a focus on ease of use and aesthetically pleasing design.
The project is currently in the sample code phase, which means that it is not yet a fully functional application.

However, I am fully committed to ensuring the successful completion of this project in the near future. I am excited about the potential of this project and look forward to seeing it evolve into a valuable tool for users.

name: This portfolio website
description: The purpose of this portfolio website is to showcase my skills and experience in graphic design and front-end development, as well as to introduce myself and highlight my projects. I have incorporated the theme of the Matrix movie into the design as it is a personal favorite of mine.
Although I designed this website in a short period of time, I have put forth my best effort to ensure its quality.

However, I recognize that there may be flaws or areas for improvement, so I would greatly appreciate any feedback or suggestions you may have. Thank you for taking the time to review my portfolio website.

name: CSite back-end
description: This is my initial full open-source back-end project, which I have also used for teaching purposes. My aim was to incorporate the latest and most cutting-edge technologies into its development.

name: CSite front-end
description: This is my first publicly available open-source Angular project, which is designed to connect with the CSite Backend project. It is important to note that in order to use these projects, one must have sufficient knowledge to run both the .Net 6 back-end and the Angular user interface.

name: FaraWAMS back-end
description: The project is being developed with the aim of monitoring and controlling power systems, and I have the role of a technical manager in this project, of course, I also do programming. It is a large-scale project and consists of five different servers.

Some servers are developed based on NodeJS, and others that require complex calculations are developed based on .Net technology. This project faces complications such as a high data rate, needs short response time, a large amount of data that should store in the database server, and event management.

name: SmartCattle back-end
description: Smart Cattle is a software as a service platform that records and analyzes the activity patterns of farm animals to monitor their health. Our team is working on developing the back-end of the platform using the latest modern technologies. The end result will be an intuitive and user-friendly tool that simplifies the farm management.

name: SmartCattle Identity Server
description: In this project, our servers were responsible for creating a complete authentication and authorization services, with single session input and output for various types of applications, such as mobile, web, native, and other services, using OpenID Connect and OAuth2.1 protocols.

name: Candle back-end
description: Candle is a platform that helps people connect and support each other during tough times. It encourages positive traits and behaviors in people and brings different generations together to foster empathy and understanding. The project was developed using: ExpressJS, Swagger, ReactJS, NextJS.

name: Simpal v2 - Full Stack
description: The purpose of developing this application is to monitor the data collected from the power grid system. In this software, various power engineering modules were used, so that experts can conduct studies on the power grid system (instead of simulation).

In this project, calculations are performed on real-time data immediately after receiving and are displayed in the form of time-series charts, bars, XY plots, flow, and heat maps. The front end of this project was developed with Angular, and .Net core 3.1 was used for its back end.

name: JS code - pages
description: I have a keen interest in front-end design and enjoy creating vanilla JS pages from time to time. In fact, I have shared my thoughts regarding vanilla JS on this page because I find it both enjoyable and easy to comprehend and share.

name: JS code - games
description: When I first started learning JavaScript, I created a variety of interesting things, including simple games. In this section of my open-source project, I have shared my original designs, which I have since upgraded to JS ES6+.

name: Restaurant Management System using ExpressJS
description: It is my first JavaScript project experience. In this project, a local management system was developed via AngularJS, NodeJS, ExpressJS, and MongoDB in order to cope with customer orders, manage warehouse, and analyze store performance.

name: Noonnet application using ExpressJS
description: An online Bread Sale application developed using: Node.js, Express.js, Mongoose, Swagger, React.js, and Material UI.
